metadata.title: CVE-2023-6932 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's ipv4: igmp componentcan be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. A race conditioncan be exploited to cause a timer be mistakenly registered on a RCU readlocked object which is freed by another thread. We recommend upgrading pastcommit e2b706c691905fe78468c361aaabc719d0a496f1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-195-generic - 3.13.0-195.246
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-195-lowlatency - 3.13.0-195.246
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-250-generic - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-250-generic - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-250-lowlatency - 4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-aws - 4.4.0-1127.133
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1173-azure - 4.15.0-1173.188~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-195.246').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-250.284~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.133').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1173.188~14.04.1').
